instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message:
820-3437-Bwith no wifi. Tried 3 different cards, cleaned the port, installed 3 different OS´s. 

J3501 Voltages:

PP3V3_WLAN: 3.351v
WIFI_EVENT_L: 1.0v
PCIE_CLK100M_AP_N: 0.5 mv
PCIE_CLK100M_AP_P: 0.3 mv
PCIE_AP_D2R_P: 1.6 mv
PCIE_AP_D2R_N: 1.7 mv
AP_PCIE_WAKE_L: 3.35 v
AP_RESET_CONN_L: 32 mv
AP_CLKREQ_Q_L: 3.3 v
USB_BT_CONN_N: 12mv
USB_BT_CONN_P: 10 mv
PP3V3_S4: 3.35v

U3540 voltages:

PP3V3_S5: 3.35v
P3V3WLAN_VMON: 1.0v
AP_RESET_L: 3.3v
AP_RESET_CONN_R_L: 3.35v
SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN: 3.34v
AP_CLKREQ_Q_L: 3.29v
AP_CLKREQ_R_L: 3.3v

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message:
Check  AP_CLKREQ_R_L  trace and connector contact.
It must drop to 0V, when airport card is attached.

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message: Yes, it drops to 0. I didn't have the card attached the first time.

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message:
Post again U3540 voltages.
Bluetooth works?

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message:
Yes, bluetooth works.

U3540 voltages with card attached:

PP3V3_S5: 3.351 v
P3V3WLAN_VMON: 1.0v
AP_RESET_L: 3.29 v
AP_RESET_CONN_R_L: 3.35v
SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN: 3.4v
AP_CLKREQ_Q_L: 0 v
AP_CLKREQ_R_L: 0 v

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message: C3530/31 look great. Traces to connector have continuity

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message:
"J3501 Voltages:
--------------
AP_RESET_CONN_L: 32 mv
AP_CLKREQ_Q_L: 3.3 v"
Check them again, with airport card connected.

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message:
Reset signal is not good.
You've reported to have 3V there before; check what happened.

threads.title: 820-3437-B no wifi
threads.message: Fixed. The was a semi-blown trace between U3540 and R3558. Thank you very much.
